conclusion: Analyzing the x-t graph to find vehicle's speed at end of 2nd second
Vertical axis represents position in meters
Horizontal axis represents time in seconds
Graph shows a straight line indicating constant acceleration
Line crosses vertical axis at x = 10 m when t = 0
Line extends with a dotted line intersecting horizontal axis at t = -2 s
To find speed, determine slope of the line
Speed is derivative of position with respect to time
For a straight line, speed is the slope of the line
Identify Point 1 at (0, 10) where t = 0 s and x = 10 m
Identify Point 2 at (-2, 0) where t = -2 s and x = 0 m
Speed at any time is v(t) = 5 m/s
At t = 2 s, speed is 5 m/s
Car's speed at end of 2nd second is 5 m/s
